Journal.Title: Isotopes in environmental and health studies

Article.ArticleTitle: <sup>210</sup>Po in popular medicinal herbs from Poland.

AbstractText: Herbs are an important part of traditional medicine in Poland. Therefore, the aim of this study was the determination of polonium <sup>210</sup>Po in 48 selected medicinal herb samples from the Polish market. The activity concentrations of <sup>210</sup>Po were measured using alpha spectrometry. The activity concentration of <sup>210</sup>Po was in the range from 0.3 ± 0.1 to 28.2 ± 0.4 Bq kg<sup>-1</sup>. The obtained results were compared with corresponding studies conducted worldwide. A higher <sup>210</sup>Po activity concentration was observed in the above-ground part of plants. The obtained results show that the highest <sup>210</sup>Po activity concentration was observed in evergreen plants and winter-hardy plants. Yet even infusions with 2 g of the most contaminated herbs examined were considered to be radiologically safe.
